framework: DSV (Deconstruct, Synthesize, and Verify) - Ablation Version
input_sentence: ego vehicle shall not overtake the vehicle in front until vehichle behind the ego is overtaking the ego vehicle.

atomic_propositions.description: Ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front

temporal_relations.description: Ego shall not overtake vehicle in front until vehicle behind overtakes ego

lexicon.ego_overtakes_front: Ego vehicle overtakes the vehicle in front

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_vehicle_front → vehicle_front
   - obj_vehicle_behind → vehicle_behind

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego, vehicle_front) [from: predicate="overtake", object="obj_ego", related_object="obj_vehicle_front"]
   - ap_2: overtake(vehicle_behind, ego) [from: predicate="overtake", object="obj_vehicle_behind", related_object="obj_ego"]

3. Apply temporal relation "until":
   - Antecedent: ~overtake(ego, vehicle_front)
   - Consequent: overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)
   - Construct: ~overtake(ego, vehicle_front) U overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)

4. Apply global property "Always":
   - Wrap entire formula with G operator: G(~overtake(ego, vehicle_front) U overtake(vehicle_behind, ego))

Final MTL Formula:
G(~overtake(ego, vehicle_front) U overtake(vehicle_behind, ego))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from "objects" list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_vehicle_front → vehicle_front
   - obj_vehicle_behind → vehicle_behind

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for atomic propositions:
   - ap_1: overtake(ego, vehicle_front) [from: predicate="overtake", object="obj_ego", related_object="obj_vehicle_front"]
   - ap_2: overtake(vehicle_behind, ego) [from: predicate="overtake", object="obj_vehicle_behind", related_object="obj_ego"]

3. Apply temporal relation "until":
   - Antecedent: ~overtake(ego, vehicle_front)
   - Consequent: overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)
   - Construct: ~overtake(ego, vehicle_front) U overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)

4. Apply global property "Always":
   - Wrap entire formula with G operator: G(~overtake(ego, vehicle_front) U overtake(vehicle_behind, ego))

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula uses the globally operator `G` which means "always" or "continuously"
- The until operator `U` has no time bounds specified, meaning it applies over the entire timeline
- The predicate `overtake(ego, vehicle_front)` represents "ego overtakes the vehicle in front"
- The predicate `overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)` represents "the vehicle behind overtakes ego"
- The negation operator `~` applied to `overtake(ego, vehicle_front)` means "ego does NOT overtake the vehicle in front"
- The structure `G(φ U ψ)` means "always, φ holds until ψ occurs"

Natural Language Translation:
Always, the ego vehicle does not overtake the vehicle in front until the vehicle behind overtakes the ego vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, the ego vehicle does not overtake the vehicle in front until the vehicle behind overtakes the ego vehicle.
verification_result.verification_reasoning:
- The formula uses the globally operator `G` which means "always" or "continuously"
- The until operator `U` has no time bounds specified, meaning it applies over the entire timeline
- The predicate `overtake(ego, vehicle_front)` represents "ego overtakes the vehicle in front"
- The predicate `overtake(vehicle_behind, ego)` represents "the vehicle behind overtakes ego"
- The negation operator `~` applied to `overtake(ego, vehicle_front)` means "ego does NOT overtake the vehicle in front"
- The structure `G(φ U ψ)` means "always, φ holds until ψ occurs"

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components

verifier.name: Verifier_Agent
verifier.description: Responsible for verifying the semantic correctness of MTL formulas through back-translation
